publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1207 Nick Johnston: Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond—That the Parliament notes the success of the "Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond" conference held in Clackmannanshire, congratulates the Rector and staff of Alva Academy on hosting this conference which brought together school children from across Europe and South Africa, and urges the Executive to ensure that this biennial event receives support in bringing together young people from different cultures to share experiences and exchange ideas and their visions for the future.
S1M-1207 Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond (lodged on 22 September 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1207 Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond (lodged on 22 September 2000) Alex Fergusson*, Mr Keith Harding*, David Mundell*

S1M-1207 Nick Johnston: Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond—That the Parliament notes the success of the "Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond" conference held in Clackmannanshire, congratulates the Rector and staff of Alva Academy on hosting this conference which brought together school children from across Europe and South Africa, and urges the Executive to ensure that this biennial event receives support in bringing together young people from different cultures to share experiences and exchange ideas and their visions for the future. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Fergusson, Mr Keith Harding, David Mundell
S1M-1207 Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond (lodged on 22 September 2000) Michael Russell*
S1M-1207 Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond (lodged on 22 September 2000) Mr David Davidson*
S1M-1207 Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond (lodged on 22 September 2000) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1207 Nick Johnston: Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond—That the Parliament notes the success of the "Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond" conference held in Clackmannanshire, congratulates the Rector and staff of Alva Academy on hosting this conference which brought together school children from across Europe and South Africa, and urges the Executive to ensure that this biennial event receives support in bringing together young people from different cultures to share experiences and exchange ideas and their visions for the future. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Fergusson, Mr Keith Harding, David Mundell, Michael Russell, Mr David Davidson, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-1207 Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond (lodged on 22 September 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Robin Harper*

Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Fergusson, Mr Keith Harding, David Mundell, Michael Russell, Mr David Davidson, Nora Radcliffe, Andrew Wilson, Robin Harper

S1M-1207 Nick Johnston: Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond—That the Parliament notes the success of the "Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond" conference held in Clackmannanshire, congratulates the Rector and staff of Alva Academy on hosting this conference which brought together school children from across Europe and South Africa, and urges the Executive to ensure that this biennial event receives support in bringing together young people from different cultures to share experiences and exchange ideas and their visions for the future. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Fergusson, Mr Keith Harding, David Mundell, Michael Russell, Mr David Davidson, Nora Radcliffe, Andrew Wilson, Robin Harper
S1M-1207 Global Citizenship in 2000 and Beyond (lodged on 22 September 2000) Mr Jamie McGrigor*
